result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keon Terrence Battle

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Keon Terrence Battle in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Keon Terrence Battle.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal was recently appointed. Has all discovery and an offer. Requesting additional time to review materials with client. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
to Court from JusticePoint regarding GPS rejection, filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring. If no GPS available, defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keon Terrence Battle appeared by video, in custody in MSDF. Attorney Colleen Taylor appeared by video for Keon Terrence Battle. Prosecuting attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Triggiano, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with DM and family.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Initial appearance scheduled via Zoom. Defendant is in custody at MSDF.  Received message from Intake Coordinator appearance was canceled and case will be rescheduled.
Defendant released from MSDF.  Intake Coordinator notified.
